summary: My latest in Jon Snow lyrical inspiration, as seen on Part 1 of our UBS Dragonstone podcast. Part 2 will feature just a bit more...
caption:
My latest in Jon Snow lyrical inspiration, as seen on Part 1 of our UBS Dragonstone podcast. Part 2 will feature just a bit more from Assassins, which will drop in a week. 

Lyrics below the cut.

[BALLADEER]
Jonny, simple man.
Born in a tower only known to Bran.
Ruled with one thought,
So away he ran,
To answer the call of the Targaryen queen
In Dragonstone!
In Dragonstone!

Saw without pause
The one true threat.
Said, “Nothing else’s
Worth a single fret.
Dragon glass will be
Our lone asset.
Don’t make a scene—
Only a king
Could ever think
To talk to a queen!”

[NORTHERN LORDS, SPOKEN]
We called your brother king. And then he rode south and lost his kingdom.

Winter is here, Your Grace. We need the King in the North in the North.

[BALLADEER]
Jonny, brooding man,
Ignored the Lords’ warnings
And formed no plan.
Strolled of a morning
All spick and span
To get imprisoned on an island
Next to King’s Landing
To answer the call of the Targaryen queen
In Dragonstone!
In Dragonstone!

Saw Daenerys there
On a throne.
Heard Daenerys say,
“The North, I own.
You have nothing to offer
And you came alone.”
But Jon just beamed,
“Only a king
Could ever think
To talk to a queen.”

[CROWD]
Jon Snow-!
[BALLADEER]
-Gave ‘em a show.
[CROWD]
Jon Snow-!
[BALLADEER]
-Was not free to go.
[CROWD]
Jon Snow-!
[BALLADEER]
-Who could say no
To a man quite as slow
as-?
[CROWD]
Jon Snow!

[TYRION & DAENERYS, SPOKEN]
Keep him occupied while we focus on the task at hand: Casterly Rock.

What was that Ser Davos said…about taking a knife in the heart for his people? Did you notice that?

You must allow them their flights of fancy; it’s dreary in the North.

[BALLADEER]
Jonny,
Humble man,
Said, “I will do what
A poor king can.”
There’s clearly nothing
More fitting than,

Sailing twice past the North
Without checking in
After being imprisoned on an island
Next to King’s Landing
To answer the call of the Targaryen queen
In Dragonstone!
In Dragonstone!

Lying in a bed, his chest
Full of scars,
He ceded his kingdom
To the Targ.
Said, “Northerners will see you
For what you are,
It’s what I’ve seen;
Our love hasn’t been on screen at all,
But screened,
And that’s our scene:
On Game of Thrones
You can be real slow,
March into traps
Or kneel away control,
I waived Northern freedom
With nothing to show…
But I talked to a queen-
I talked to a queen!
caption_abstract:
My latest in Jon Snow lyrical inspiration, as seen on Part 1 of our UBS Dragonstone podcast. Part 2 will feature just a bit more from Assassins, which will drop in a week. 

Lyrics below the cut.

summary:
JON: And how should I be smarter? By listening to you?
SANSA: I'm the Stark who has survived living with both the Lannisters AND...
body:
JON: And how should I be smarter? By listening to you?
SANSA: I'm the Stark who has survived living with both the Lannisters AND the Boltons. YES YOU SHOULD LISTEN TO ME.

tags: they are both stand-ins for sansa
summary:
For those who have read the books (I might be slow, I know)...
Alys (Karstark) + Jeyne (Poole)
= Al(a)yne = Sansa
Sansa is the...
body:
For those who have read the books (I might be slow, I know)…

Alys (Karstark) + Jeyne (Poole)

= Al(a)yne = Sansa

Sansa is the girl Mel was talking about, they are just both foreshadowings for her. If she wasn’t important why would Mel have a vision of her.

blog.name: incorrect-got-quotes
blog.title: Dead, almost like my interest in the show
blog.description: I post quotes when I feel like it. Mostly nowadays I don’t.If you want to use one of the quotes as a story or drawing prompt, I'm fine with that, as long as you credit me in your story or art. Also, tag any drawings under #oberyn’s saucy art. Yes, I am in fact Oberyn Martell. For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

tags: I’ve seen this dialouge countless of times
summary:
Gif credit @thelawyerthatwaspromised 
So I saw @thelawyerthatwaspromised new meta and it had me thinking about something that’s...
body:
This Undermine Line is a Trope Within Itself!

Gif credit @thelawyerthatwaspromised

So I saw @thelawyerthatwaspromised new meta and it had me thinking about something that’s been bugging me and that I’ve wanted to address for awhile.

Ok so when I was watching this scene and Jon said this line my immediate reaction in my mind was like “Wow they’re giving off major couple vibes,” and this was WAY before I shipped Jonsa. I want to be clear. I didn’t pick up couple vibes because they were fighting, I picked up couple vibes because Jon said YOU UNDERMINE ME!

Y’all this line is a trope within itself! Do you know the amount of the times I’ve seen this line or versions of this line said in a movie or a tv show?! In every single case that I’ve seen this line said it’s always involves a guy who is typically the head of the house or a leader in some form and he’s always saying this to a woman who happens to be his wife, girlfriend, or love interest!

Don’t get me wrong I am in no way endorsing or saying that this is an acceptable trope or trying to discuss male or female roles, but what I’m trying to address is that you undermine me/ you’re undermining my authority has been used many times over in Hollywood in the way that I’ve described above!

That’s why when I was watching it live and Jon said that line, I immediately recognized it for what that line was trying to depict because I had seen this countless of times before. That wasn’t Jon trying to address his “sister,” that was Jon addressing HIS PARTNER who feels anything but a sister to him!

This is why I was so surprised by the swift reaction against Sansa where everyone seemed to scream she undermines Jon. Maybe it’s because it’s Sansa and some people can’t look pass their dislike for her but this whole dialogue wasn’t meant to be contentious. It was meant to highlight the subtext of what’s going on here. I think the undermining line in particular was supposed to be a dead giveaway!

But seriously y’all, am I crazy?! Is it just me who has seen versions of this undermine me line countless of times with romantic couples in movies and shows?

Actually scratch that! I don’t think I’m wrong at all because I know for a FACT that this same scenario has been played out time and time again always with a romantic connotation. I want to hear your thoughts though so tell me what you think!

Also I’m tagging the screenwriters of this fandom because I would love to hear your thoughts on this! @fortunatelylori @bitchcakegreen

blog.name: rone-of-house-targaryen
blog.title: Fire and Blood
blog.description: Jonerys shipper till the day I die. Right proper lad. Cancer. Will not stand for the sullying of The Dragon Queen. Jonerys from this day till my last. RoneOfHouseTargaryen on Ao3. Long live Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen.

body:
Unpopular GOT Opinion

Tyrion accidentally helped Jon and Daenerys fall in love and trust each other, but hasn’t helped out in any other way: Tyrion has been very important as a friend to Daenerys but he’s neen terrible as an advisor/hand. In S6 while Dany was with the Dosh Khaleen, Tyrion barely kept things in order and his plan to slowly abolish Slavery blew up in his face. In S7 he couldn’t forsee losing the Iron Islands and Dorne to Euron Greyjoy’s ambush/kidnapping of The Sand Snakes and Yara Greyjoy. Then he suggests to take Casterly Rock with the Unsullied while Cersei basically said to hell with Casterly Rock had High Garden invaded, The Reach seized, and Olenna killed in the process. I understand he basically got out maneuvered military wise by Jamie and Tyrion isn’t a Military strategist, but the straw that broke the camel’s back is tge Wight Hunt. Did anyone else have a better idea? No, if so it wasn’t said. Yet still people seem to forget it was Tyrion who suggested it, It was Tyrion who concocted the plan that lead to Viserion being killed, Jon almost dying, and Uncle Benjen sacrificing his life for Jon’s. The one good thing to come from all of this is Dany gaining trust and falling in live with Jon and vice versa. It was Tyrion who put in a good word for Jon to start, Tyrion suggested Jon ask for something more reasonable(dragonglass, which lead to Jon amd Dany alone in a cave), Tyrion also suggested Jon speak to people who follow Daenerys(Missandei) to better understand why they follow. Even Tyrion’s failures as hand helped. Daenerys leaned on Jon more and trusted his council in a time of need because Tyrion couldn’t advise his way out of a brothel at this point. The Wight hunt lead to Dany saving Jon and company (against Tyrion’s advisement btw) which lead to Dany pledging herself to the North and Jon pledging himself to Dany. Even the debacle that was the meeting in the Dragon Pit where Cersei lied about helping in the Great War lead to Jon and Dany’s “We sail together” moment and we all know what’s going on, on that boat right now. So, besides accidentally helping The King in the North and Dragon Queen fall in love Tyrion has been useless and ain’t purposely help this realm as hand yet.

reblog.comment:
Unpopular GOT Opinion

Tyrion accidentally helped Jon and Daenerys fall in love and trust each other, but hasn’t helped out in any other way: Tyrion has been very important as a friend to Daenerys but he’s neen terrible as an advisor/hand. In S6 while Dany was with the Dosh Khaleen, Tyrion barely kept things in order and his plan to slowly abolish Slavery blew up in his face. In S7 he couldn’t forsee losing the Iron Islands and Dorne to Euron Greyjoy’s ambush/kidnapping of The Sand Snakes and Yara Greyjoy. Then he suggests to take Casterly Rock with the Unsullied while Cersei basically said to hell with Casterly Rock had High Garden invaded, The Reach seized, and Olenna killed in the process. I understand he basically got out maneuvered military wise by Jamie and Tyrion isn’t a Military strategist, but the straw that broke the camel’s back is tge Wight Hunt. Did anyone else have a better idea? No, if so it wasn’t said. Yet still people seem to forget it was Tyrion who suggested it, It was Tyrion who concocted the plan that lead to Viserion being killed, Jon almost dying, and Uncle Benjen sacrificing his life for Jon’s. blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

tags: My favorite relationships in GOT are Jon-Arya and Jon-Dany
I hope we get lots of both these pairings next season
And some Arya-Dany wil also be nice
Yes I am greedy for some good Jon moments next season
summary: Jonerys from the perspective of a Jon fan…
title: Jonerys from the perspective of a Jon fan…
body:
As a Jon fan I would like to explain why I like the Jon x Dany ship.

Being a Jon fan means that I relate to the character, agree with everything he does and will defend/justify his actions to the very end. I can acknowledge that he has flaws and at the same time try to see things from his POV.

As a book reader, my favorite Jon relationship is with Arya. I am a sucker for good big brother/little sister  relationships and Jon-Arya is one of the best sibling relationships present in the book. In fact I would go ahead and say that Jon-Arya is the best and most important relationship in the books, period. They love each other unconditionally and it’s healthy and all things good.  I mean, how can folks read things like this:

Needle was Jon Snow’s smile. He used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes.

Bring her home, Mance… You owe me this one little girl.

What do you know of my heart, priestess? What do you know of my sister?

and not love them! I wish they would meet up soon and if there is one thing I am desperately looking forward to next season, it’s Jon and Arya reuniting again. If D&D mess this up, you can expect me to write long ranting essays on here about it!

And well, Jon and Ghost are pretty much about a boy and his dog and I love them to bits. Ghost is a part of Jon and I am glad he is around next season. And I love Jon’s bromance with Sam - best friends forever!

Now, coming to Jonerys, I knew that Jon/Dany would eventually meet and the books had foreshadowed some sort of an alliance between them. My favorite characters have always been Jon and Arya and while I liked Dany, I was not exactly all that invested in her story. Until last season that is.

And man, did I like her last season. The Lannisters have heaped untold misery on the Starks and Westeros for 7 seasons now and seeing Dany on Drogon and her Dothraki army crush them in battle was orgasmic. I was hoping for her to defeat Cersei/Jaime and cursing Tyrion for fucking up everything with his stupid plans. 

And well, I liked Jon and Dany’s burgeoning relationship. After two seasons of Sansa constantly telling Jon that he knows nothing and questioning his every decision, it was refreshing to have someone ask Jon for advice!  As per Sophie Turner’s comments at Comic Con – “[Sansa] doesn’t think he [Jon] has the intellect, the knowledge, and the experience that she has, and I concur.” This reflects in Sansa’s behavior towards Jon where she thinks that Jon should do as she says because she knows better.

But Jon is an intelligent, pragmatic leader. As Sam Tarly put it, he was elected twice to lead the Night’s Watch and the North. He ended an eight thousand year feud between the NW and the Wildlings, uniting the Free Folk with the North. He tried to make common cause with the enemy Boltons in order to unite against the White Walkers. People like Davos and Lyanna Mormont follow him because they see him as a true leader. Gendry just met the guy and he is immediately loyal. Jon has that effect on people. Theon points out how Jon always does the right thing – no matter how hard it is to do it. Jon understands the sanctity of treaties and deals and is pretty much the only leader in Westeros who holds true to his words.

And I like that Dany recognizes this and respects Jon’s ‘intellect, knowledge and experience’. She ignores Tyrion and asks Jon what he thinks she should do. And then takes his advice and attacks the Lannister/Tyrell army instead of KL. Towards the end, she takes his advice of sailing together to WF, overruling Jorah’s suggestion. I love it when characters acknowledge that Jon is a smart leader. I liked that she rushed North to save Jon, Jorah and the rest of them against Tyrion’s advice. I liked her telling Jon that though she disagreed with his announcement in the dragonpit, she respected his decision to do so.

I liked that Jon was diplomatic and treated Dany with respect as well – offering her his advice as a suggestion and leaving it up to her whether to take it or not.

I just loved the way Emilia Clarke played Dany falling for Jon. She was like a young girl falling in love for the first time. The way she asked Tyrion – ‘And what does the KITN want with Dragon glass?’ – it was like she found the KITN to be frustratingly cute and lovable despite having an obsession with the army of the dead! Or when she softly said ‘ you better get to work Jon Snow’ or how she could not hide her excitement at sailing together with Jon. I loved season 7 Dany.

I love that Jon now has the support of the most powerful leader in Westeros. It was getting a bit tiresome to constantly hear about how the Vale army was only there for Sansa. Well, Jon has now come North with the dragon queen, dragons, thousands of Dothraki and Unsullied, some great advisers and fighters. If Yohn Royce and the Vale wants to support someone else as leader, they are welcome to do so. Jon would be able to manage just fine without them.

And considering all the constant hate Dany has got here on Tumblr, I find myself defending her more and more. And it’s had the effect of making me like Dany all the more. Dany now joins the ranks of Jon and Arya as one of my favorite characters in the series. And well Jon loves her and I like the characters who make him happy and appreciate him for who he is.

So that’s my perspective on why as a Jon fan, I like the Jon-Dany relationship. I know folks are going to be rolling their eyes at the effusive praise I have heaped on Jon! But hey, he’s my fave and I think he deserves everything good so there it is 😊

Or when she softly said ‘ you better get to work Jon Snow’ or how she could not hide her excitement at sailing together with Jon. I loved season 7 Dany.

I love that Jon now has the support of the most powerful leader in Westeros. It was getting a bit tiresome to constantly hear about how the Vale army was only there for Sansa. Well, Jon has now come North with the dragon queen, dragons, thousands of Dothraki and Unsullied, some great advisers and fighters. If Yohn Royce and the Vale wants to support someone else as leader, they are welcome to do so. Jon would be able to manage just fine without them.

And considering all the constant hate Dany has got here on Tumblr, I find myself defending her more and more. And it’s had the effect of making me like Dany all the more. Dany now joins the ranks of Jon and Arya as one of my favorite characters in the series. And well Jon loves her and I like the characters who make him happy and appreciate him for who he is.

So that’s my perspective on why as a Jon fan, I like the Jon-Dany relationship. I know folks are going to be rolling their eyes at the effusive praise I have heaped on Jon! But hey, he’s my fave and I think he deserves everything good so there it is 😊

Or when she softly said ‘ you better get to work Jon Snow’ or how she could not hide her excitement at sailing together with Jon. I loved season 7 Dany.

I love that Jon now has the support of the most powerful leader in Westeros. It was getting a bit tiresome to constantly hear about how the Vale army was only there for Sansa. Well, Jon has now come North with the dragon queen, dragons, thousands of Dothraki and Unsullied, some great advisers and fighters. If Yohn Royce and the Vale wants to support someone else as leader, they are welcome to do so. Jon would be able to manage just fine without them.

And considering all the constant hate Dany has got here on Tumblr, I find myself defending her more and more. And it’s had the effect of making me like Dany all the more. Dany now joins the ranks of Jon and Arya as one of my favorite characters in the series. And well Jon loves her and I like the characters who make him happy and appreciate him for who he is.

So that’s my perspective on why as a Jon fan, I like the Jon-Dany relationship. I know folks are going to be rolling their eyes at the effusive praise I have heaped on Jon! But hey, he’s my fave and I think he deserves everything good so there it is 😊

body:
Only woman who is beautiful like Ashara Dayne is Daenerys Targaryen in whole ASOIAF.

Only Baristan Salmy mentions Ashara when he looked at Dany

Ashara Dayne was the biggest love of Ned Stark. Many years people thought that Jon was son of Ashara and Ned Stark.

When the great star bleeding the prince was borne. This Star was Arthur Dayne brother of Ashara Dayne . And in house of Prince “Dragonstone” was borne his princess.

“Princess of Dragonstone”.

Dany is a princess who was promised for his prince .
